Note::Official Notice of Custody Transfer

Note::Subject: Angela Melnic

Note::Producer: Julia Melnic

Note::Recipient: SATURN I.M.

Note::This document certifies that one Angela Melnik is now a ward of the Saturn Interior Ministry.  This will be our final communication barring further requests for information.  

[[p:So, Julia put Angela up for adoption?]]
[[p:Guess Julia didn't love her kid very much.  I can respect that.]]

passages.text:
The suitcase is stuffed with an assortment of odd items - ribbons, pens, and a conspicuous pair of children's shoes.

You also find a stacked array of contracts, checks, and receipts.  

One document in particular catches you eye: a notice of custody transfer.

Wiggly::They take in indigent children, teach them vocational skills, provide some employment.

Wiggly::Really kind of them, to look after kids in Angela's position.

[[p:Just like they were "kind" to you, right?]]

Wiggly::I, uh, would like to think her feelings were more complicated.  But perhaps.

Wiggly::He would have been well off in the care of the SATURN Interior Ministry.

Wiggly::They take in indigent children, teach them vocational skills, provide some employment, eventually.

passages.text:
Wiggly::Yeah, exactly!  Such good people.

Wiggly::But I was in a totally different program than the one Thomas got put into.  He probably just got put in charge of telegrammatic upkeep or something, closer to the core.

Jasper::Wiggly really doesn't seem to see anything wrong with how he was treated here.

Jasper::He's a grown man with the psychological profile of a puppy.

Wiggly::Hey, what's that on the back of the notice?  Looks like a note of some sort

[[p:(Action) Check the back of the notice.->Page 2]]

passages.text:
Note::Postscript:

Note::I don't often include personal notes with these notices but these are unique circumstances.  Most women who put a child in our program don't live two floors above in the same building.  

Note::Some of my colleagues have expressed concerns that living in such close proximity to your former child might cause psychological duress.  Be informed that while we permit visitation, we don't encourage it, and two days prior notice is required in all cases.

Note::Rosalind, Program Director.

Jasper::There it is again.

Wiggly::That's your Mom again, right?  So I guess Angela wasn't sent to the Interior.

[[p:No, he was sent downstairs.  To Mom.]]
[[p:Angela ended up in Mom's program.  Do you think that's why Julia clung to me?]]

Wiggly::...No.  I don't think that's a coincidence.  

Wiggly::I'm not sure we know enough to say for sure, though.  And I'm not sure that lead is going to be very helpful for shaking Julia off, either.
passages.name: p:Angela ended up in Mom's program.  Do you think that's why Julia clung to me?

passages.text:
You enter a room lined with dozens of decrepit suitcases.  The air is stagnant and full of particulate - you feel as though you are the first to breathe this air in decades.

The suitcases look like they haven't been disturbed in a very long time.  They might disintegrate if you were to pick them up. 

Wiggly::This room was a communal storage area for patients and nurses.  Hardly anyone had time to retrieve their belongings before evacuating, so all of their stuff is still here.

Wiggly::We should look through these suitcases.  There's a good chance one of them belonged to Julia.

[[I feel like I should be doing this with gloves, and an archeologist's brush.]]
